thread.title: Premier Oil secures two blocks in Gulf of Mexico with JV partners
thread.title_full: Premier Oil secures two blocks in Gulf of Mexico with JV partners

title: Premier Oil secures two blocks in Gulf of Mexico with JV partners
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Thu, Jul 16, 2015, 10:51 BST - UK Markets close in 5 hrs 39 mins Premier Oil secures two blocks in Gulf of Mexico with JV partners By Michele Maatouk | Sharecast â€“ 1 hour 11 minutes ago 36.46 +0.05 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - Premier Oil (LSE: PMO.L - news ) and its joint venture partners Talos Energy and Sierra Oil & Gas have been awarded two blocks as part of Mexico's Round 1 shallow water licensing round. The company said that Blocks 2 and 7, which it was awarded, contain numerous leads in established and emerging plays, located in the shallow water Sureste Basin, which is a proven and prolific hydrocarbon province in the Gulf of Mexico. 
It said the blocks contain tertiary clastic clays, typical of the Salinas sub-basin. 
The plan is to acquire, evaluate and reprocess 3D seismic data with a view to firming up drilling locations towards the end of 2016, said Premier (NasdaqGS: PINC - news ) . 
Chief executive Tony Durrant said: "We are very pleased with the outcome of this round which provides Premier with a low cost entry point to emerging plays in a proven oil and gas province." At 08:20, shares were up 0.8% at 148.50p.
